result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 2:18 PM Defendant Charles R. Kuhn in court, in custody.  Attorney Terry L. Nussberger in court for Charles R. Kuhn.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Plea agreement recited into the record.  Plea of guilty   Count 1 - misd battery - 22CF21 and plea of guilty - 22CF19-  count 1 - burglary party to a crime.  Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of  Count 1 - misd battery - 22CF21 and plea of guilty - 22CF19-  count 1 - burglary party to a crime.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Statement by Attorney Nussberger.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders withheld sentence and placement on probation - 22CF21 - 2 years and 2CF19 - 3 years with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; restitution to be determined within 30 days of sentencing and joint and several with Anthony Marshall; letter of apology to the victims due within 30 days of sentencing and preapproved by probation; AODA; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation - 22CF19 no contact with Anthony Marshall.  11 days of sentence credit on each case.   Court dismisses and read in the remaining counts and 22CM24. Payment plan of $25.00 a month beginning October 1, 2022.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Letter to the Court from Attorney Nussberger

3:38 PM Defendant Charles R. Kuhn not in court.  Attorney Terry L. Nussberger in court for Charles R. Kuhn.  Attorney Kristi Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied.  Statement by Attorney Nussberger.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a body only warrant.  Attorney Tlusty has no objection to staying the warrant until 4:30 today.  Court issues body only warrants and stay until 4:30 today.  Clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings and stay until 4:30 today.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:50 PM Defendant Charles R. Kuhn in court.  Attorney Terry L. Nussberger in court for Charles R. Kuhn.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. 01:09 PM Defendant Charles R. Kuhn in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nussberger is retained by defendant.   Defendant waives reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Court advised defendant of right to attorney.   Court enters a plea of not guilty on defendant's behalf.  Court orders a signature bond in the amount of $5,000.00; booking.  Status hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 09:00 am. - rt
